Find the value of $r$ such that \[\frac{r^2 - 5r + 4}{r^2-8r+7} = \frac{r^2 - 2r -15}{r^2 -r - 20}.\]
ground_truth: We could cross-multiply, but that looks terrifying.  Instead, we start by factoring each of the quadratics, hoping that we'll get some convenient cancellation.  Factoring each of the 4 quadratics gives  \[\frac{(r-4)(r-1)}{(r-7)(r-1)} = \frac{(r-5)(r+3)}{(r-5)(r+4)}.\]Canceling the common factors on each side gives us  \[\frac{r-4}{r-7} = \frac{r+3}{r+4}.\]Cross-multiplying gives $(r-4)(r+4) = (r+3)(r-7)$.  Expanding both sides gives $r^2 - 16 = r^2 - 4r - 21$.  Solving for $r$ gives $r=\boxed{-5/4}$.

$$\Rightarrow (r^2 - 5r + 4)(r^2 -r - 20) = (r^2 - 2r -15)(r^2-8r+7)$$

$$\Rightarrow r^4 - r^3 - 20r^2 + 5r^3 -5r^2 -40r + 4r^2 -4r -80 = r^4 -8r^3 +7r^2 - 2r^3 +15r^2 -210 +15r^2 -30r +105$$

$$\Rightarrow r^4 - r^3 - 20r^2 + 5r^3 -5r^2 -40r + 4r^2 -4r -80 = r^4 -8r^3 +7r^2 - 2r^3 +15r^2$$

$$\Rightarrow - r^3 - 20r^2 + 5r^3 -5r^2 -40r + 4r^2 -4r -80 = -8r^3 +7r^2 - 2r^3 +15r^2$$

$$\Rightarrow  4r^3 -20r^2+ 5r^2 -40r + 4r^2 -4r -80 = -8r^3 +7r^2 - 2r^3 +15r^2$$

$$\Rightarrow 4r^3 + 8r^3 +20r^2 -5r^2 +7r^2 -15r^2 - 40r -4r =0$$

$$\Rightarrow  12r^3 +12r^2 - 44r =0$$

$$\Rightarrow 12(r^3 +r^2 - 11r/3)=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r^3 +r^2 - 11r/3=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r(r^2 +r - 11/3)=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r(r^2 +4r - 3r - 11/3)=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r(r(r+4) - 3(r+4))=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r(r-3)(r+4)=0$$

$$\Rightarrow r=0 \text{ or } r=3 \text{ or } r=-4$$

**Final Answer: $\boxed{0; 3; -4}$. I hope it is correct.**
